title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0103

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we have another romantic lesson, kind of romantic.
segments.cn: 今天我们有另一节浪漫的课，有点浪漫。

segments.en: A little romantic.
We've got a boyfriend and a girlfriend and they're apologizing to each other.
segments.cn: 我们有一对情侣，他们在互相道歉。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a very common situation and we're going to be talking about love.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个非常常见的情况，我们将谈论爱情。

segments.en: We're also going to talk about different pet names that are commonly used in English.
segments.cn: 我们还将讨论一些在英语中常用的宠物名字。

segments.en: That are used with your boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 用于你的男朋友或女朋友。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
So, let's listen to this dialogue for the first time and see what's happening with our couple.
segments.cn: 那么，让我们第一次听这个对话，看看我们的情侣发生了什么。

segments.en: Can we talk?
Sure, honey.
We're talking now, aren't we?
segments.cn: 我们现在在谈话，不是吗？

segments.en: You know what I mean.
Yeah, I know.
I want to know where this relationship is going.
segments.cn: 我想知道这段关系要去哪里。

segments.en: I'm in love with you and I need to know... You know, I think you're awesome.
segments.cn: 我爱你，我需要知道……你知道，我觉得你很棒。

segments.en: I'm awesome.
Well, I guess that's my answer, isn't it?
segments.cn: 好吧，我想这就是我的答案，不是吗？

segments.en: Honey.
Look, if you don't love me, it's not a thing, all right?
segments.cn: 听着，如果你不爱我，那也没关系，好吗？

segments.en: We've had our laughs, but I don't appreciate... Well, maybe it's just time we...
segments.cn: 我们有过快乐的时光，但我不欣赏……好吧，也许是时候我们……

segments.en: Baby, I love you so much.
You do?
I love you and I think you're awesome.
Oh, I love you too.
Come on, put the gun down.
Oh, baby.
I'm so sorry.
Okay, so romantic and dramatic.
Yeah, I think she really needed to hear that... Right, so I think she really wanted to hear, I love you.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得她真的需要听到这个……对，所以我觉得她真的想听，我爱你。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
And there's some interesting phrases here in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 这个对话中有一些有趣的短语。

segments.en: And today we're going to focus mostly on phrases.
segments.cn: 今天我们将主要关注短语。

segments.en: So, why don't we start with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么，我们为什么不从流利表达开始呢？

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
Okay, on Fluency Builder today, we are going to take a look at some of these phrases.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在流利表达中，我们将看看这些短语。

segments.en: And the first one is very important and very different.
segments.cn: 第一个非常重要且非常不同。

segments.en: So obviously this dialogue is about love.
segments.cn: 显然，这个对话是关于爱情的。

segments.en: And we heard two different ways that this word is used.
segments.cn: 我们听到了这个词的两种不同用法。

segments.en: And the first one is to love someone.
Right, so he said, I love you.
Yeah, I love you.
We all pretty much understand what that means.
segments.cn: 我们都大致理解这是什么意思。

segments.en: Right, but they also mentioned to be in love with someone.
segments.cn: 对，但他们还提到爱上某人。

segments.en: Okay, so he said, I am in love with you.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他说，我爱上你了。

segments.en: I'm in love with you.
In love.
Okay, so what's the difference between to love and to be in love?
segments.cn: 好的，那么爱和爱上有什么区别？

segments.en: To be in love with someone means that you have these strong romantic feelings towards somebody.
segments.cn: 爱上某人意味着你对某人有强烈的浪漫感情。

segments.en: That's right.
So you can only be in love with your boyfriend, your girlfriend, your husband or your wife.
segments.cn: 所以你只能爱上你的男朋友、女朋友、丈夫或妻子。

segments.en: So you can love your parents, you can love your family, but you can't be in love with them.
segments.cn: 所以你可以爱你的父母，你可以爱你的家人，但你不能爱上他们。

segments.en: You can only be in love with your girlfriend, boyfriend, husband, wife.
segments.cn: 你只能爱上你的女朋友、男朋友、丈夫、妻子。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay, so moving on to the next phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来是下一个短语。

segments.en: Now the girl asked her boyfriend, can we talk?
segments.cn: 现在女孩问她的男朋友，我们可以谈谈吗？

segments.en: Can we talk?
Can we talk?
This is a very simple sentence.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常简单的句子。

segments.en: Right, we know the meaning, right?
But why does she say, can we talk?
segments.cn: 但她为什么说，我们可以谈谈吗？

segments.en: Okay, so you use this when you want to start a conversation about something serious.
segments.cn: 好的，当你想开始谈论一些严肃的事情时，你会使用这个。

segments.en: Okay, so if you wanted to talk to me about my new shirt.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你想和我谈谈我的新衬衫。

segments.en: I wouldn't ask, I wouldn't say, hey Marco, can we talk?
segments.cn: 我不会问，我不会说，嘿Marco，我们可以谈谈吗？

segments.en: Oh, I really like your shirt.
segments.cn: 哦，我真的很喜欢你的衬衫。

segments.en: Where'd you get it?
Exactly, right?
It has to be serious.
It has to be serious.
So usually if somebody says, hey, can we talk?
segments.cn: 所以通常如果有人说，嘿，我们可以谈谈吗？

segments.en: It means that there's going to be a serious topic.
segments.cn: 这意味着将会有一个严肃的话题。

segments.en: It's going to be probably bad news.
Maybe bad news.
So can we talk?
So if your boyfriend or girlfriend tells you this, well, it's not a good sign.
segments.cn: 所以如果你的男朋友或女朋友告诉你这个，那就不是一个好兆头。

segments.en: That's right.
Alright, and the last phrase that we have on Fluency Builder, you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 好的，最后一个短语是，你知道我是什么意思。

segments.en: You know what I mean.
You know what I mean.
You know what I mean.
Alright, so again, this phrase is very simple to understand, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以这个短语很简单理解，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
So you know what I'm talking about.
segments.cn: 所以你知道我在说什么。

segments.en: You understand me.
But the interesting thing is that we can also make it a question.
segments.cn: 但有趣的是，我们也可以把它变成一个问题。

segments.en: And it's all about the change in tone.
Okay, so with this in mind, let's listen to two examples of the same phrase, but with different tones, and you try to see which one is the question.
segments.cn: 好的，考虑到这一点，让我们听听同一个短语的两个例子，但语调不同，你试着看看哪个是问题。

segments.en: Example three.
Alright,
so we heard the examples and well, maybe you guessed it right.
segments.cn: 所以我们听到了例子，嗯，也许你猜对了。

segments.en: The second example was the question.
That's right.
You know what I mean?
Right.
So basically you're asking the person if they understand your idea or they understand what you're talking about.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你是在问对方是否理解你的想法，或者他们理解你在说什么。

segments.en: So maybe you can say, so the professor wasn't very clear on his instructions.
segments.cn: 所以也许你可以说，教授对他的指示不是很清楚。

segments.en: So how was I supposed to do the homework?
You know what I mean.
So you're asking me to confirm that I understand you.
segments.cn: 所以你是在问我是否理解你。

segments.en: My idea.
You understand what I'm saying?
Yeah.
Okay.
And if it was a statement, I might say, Hey, I don't like going to your mom's house.
segments.cn: 如果这是一个陈述，我可能会说，嘿，我不喜欢去你妈妈家。

segments.en: So I would say, what, what, what do you mean?
segments.cn: 所以我会问，什么，什么，你是什么意思？

segments.en: Why?
You know what I mean?
segments.cn: 你知道我是什么意思吗？

segments.en: Right.
So I perfectly understand or know the reasons why you don't like going to my mom's house.
segments.cn: 所以我完全理解你不喜欢去我妈妈家的原因。

segments.en: Like I don't have to tell you, you know what I mean?
segments.cn: 就像我不需要告诉你，你知道我是什么意思？

segments.en: All right.
Very good.
So you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 所以你知道我是什么意思。

segments.en: Great.
So we've taken a look at these four phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们看了这四个短语。

segments.en: They're very simple, but the way that you use them gives them different meanings.
segments.cn: 它们很简单，但你使用它们的方式赋予了它们不同的含义。

segments.en: That's right.
All right.
So let's listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 所以我们再听一次我们的对话。

segments.en: Let's slow it down a little bit, and then we'll come back and look at some more phrases.
segments.cn: 我们慢一点，然后再回来看看更多短语。

segments.en: Can we talk?
Sure, honey.
We're talking now, aren't we?
segments.cn: 我们现在在谈论，不是吗？

segments.en: You know what I mean.
Yeah, I know.
I want to know where this relationship is going.
segments.cn: 我想知道这段关系要去哪里。

segments.en: I'm in love with you and I need to know... You know, I think you're awesome.
segments.cn: 我爱你，我需要知道……你知道，我觉得你很棒。

segments.en: I'm awesome.
Well, I guess that's my answer, isn't it?
segments.cn: 好吧，我想这就是我的答案，不是吗？

segments.en: Honey.
Look, if you don't love me, it's not a thing, all right?
segments.cn: 听着，如果你不爱我，那没关系，好吗？

segments.en: We've had our laughs, but I don't appreciate...
segments.cn: 我们有过快乐，但我不欣赏……

segments.en: Maybe it's just time we...
Baby, I love you so much.
You do?
I love you and I think you're awesome.
Oh, I love you too.
Come on, put the gun down.
Oh, baby.
I'm so sorry.
Okay, so now it's time for us to take a look at some more phrases, but this time we're going to look at them in putting it together.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是时候看看更多短语了，但这次我们要把它们结合起来。

segments.en: Putting it together.
Okay, we're going to see how we can use these phrases in a few different situations.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们将看看如何在几种不同的情况下使用这些短语。

segments.en: So the girl wanted to talk to her boyfriend because she wanted to know where this relationship is going.
segments.cn: 所以女孩想和她的男朋友谈谈，因为她想知道这段关系要去哪里。

segments.en: Right, where is this relationship going?
Where is this relationship going?
So she wants to know what's going to happen or what's... What's the future?
segments.cn: 所以她想知道将会发生什么，或者……未来是什么？

segments.en: What's the future of this relationship?
segments.cn: 这段关系的未来是什么？

segments.en: Are we going to get married?
Are we just... what's happening?
So why don't we listen to some examples with different nouns and how we can use this phrase.
segments.cn: 所以我们为什么不听一些不同名词的例子，以及我们如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: Example one.
I don't know where my career is going in this company.
segments.cn: 我不知道我在这家公司职业生涯要去哪里。

segments.en: I don't see any potential for growth.
segments.cn: 我看不到任何成长的潜力。

segments.en: Example two.
This movie is so confusing.
I have no idea where the plot is going.
segments.cn: 我不知道情节要去哪里。

segments.en: Example three.
We have been in this meeting for over two hours and I still don't know where it's going.
segments.cn: 我们在这个会议上已经超过两个小时，我仍然不知道要去哪里。

segments.en: Okay, so again, this phrase is just asking about the future of something.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这个短语只是询问某事的未来。

segments.en: Right, so where the future of this movie... Where is this movie going?
segments.cn: 对，所以这部电影的未来……这部电影要去哪里？

segments.en: Yeah, what's happening?
Right, what's going to happen?
Yeah.
Or your career, etc.
Yeah.
Okay, and so the girl, you know, she was talking a little bit about her feelings and she said, maybe it's just time we...
segments.cn: 好吧，所以女孩，你知道，她稍微谈了一下她的感受，她说，也许是时候我们……

segments.en: Okay, so this phrase isn't complete yet.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这个短语还没有完成。

segments.en: Yeah.
We need to finish it.
Yeah.
But she is basically saying, maybe we should do this.
segments.cn: 但她基本上是在说，也许我们应该这样做。

segments.en: How can we finish the phrase?
segments.cn: 我们如何完成这个短语？

segments.en: All right, so she could say, maybe it's just time we break up.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以她可以说，也许是时候我们分手。

segments.en: All right, or I can say, maybe it's time we have a baby.
segments.cn: 好吧，或者我可以说，也许是时候我们要个孩子。

segments.en: Oh, Marco.
Or even, maybe it's time we go home.
segments.cn: 或者甚至，也许是时候我们回家。

segments.en: Okay, so it's getting late, let's go home.
segments.cn: 好吧，时间不早了，我们回家吧。

segments.en: Maybe it's time we go home.
Yeah.
So this is how we can finish this phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们如何完成这个短语。

segments.en: And what about our last phrase?
segments.cn: 那我们的最后一个短语呢？

segments.en: So she also said, we've had our laughs.
segments.cn: 所以她还说，我们有过快乐。

segments.en: Okay, so that means we've had our good times.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着我们有过美好的时光。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay.
But we can change this to, we've had our ups and downs.
segments.cn: 但我们可以把它改成，我们有过起伏。

segments.en: Okay, or we've had our moments, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，或者我们有过时刻，对吧？

segments.en: So that means we've had our good moments and our bad moments.
segments.cn: 这意味着我们有过美好的时刻和糟糕的时刻。

segments.en: That's right.
Or we've had our issues.
Okay, so that means we've had some problems, we've had some difficulties.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着我们有过一些问题，我们有过一些困难。

segments.en: Or even we've had our moments.
segments.cn: 或者甚至我们有过时刻。

segments.en: Okay, so that means we've had...
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着我们有过……

segments.en: Special times.
So that means we've had our special times, special occasions that we will always remember.
segments.cn: 这意味着我们有过特殊的时光，特殊的场合，我们将永远记住。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay.
So three really useful structures that you can change the words a little bit to slightly change the meaning.
segments.cn: 所以有三个非常有用的结构，你可以稍微改变一下词语来稍微改变意思。

segments.en: Okay, so it's time for us to listen to our dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是我们最后一次听对话的时间了。

segments.en: Now we're ready to understand everything.
segments.cn: 现在我们准备好理解一切了。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and give you some examples of pet names in English.
segments.cn: 然后我们会回来给你一些英文宠物名字的例子。

segments.en: Can we talk?
Sure, honey.
We're talking now, aren't we?
segments.cn: 我们现在在谈话，不是吗？

segments.en: You know what I mean.
Yeah, I know.
I want to know where this relationship is going.
segments.cn: 我想知道这段关系要去哪里。

segments.en: I'm in love with you.
And I need to know... You know, I think you're awesome.
segments.cn: 我需要知道... 你知道，我觉得你很棒。

segments.en: I'm awesome.
Well, I guess that's my answer, isn't it?
segments.cn: 好吧，我想这就是我的答案，对吧？

segments.en: Look, if you don't love me, it's not a thing.
segments.cn: 听着，如果你不爱我，那也没关系。

segments.en: All right.
We've had our laughs, but I don't appreciate... Well, maybe it's just time we...
segments.cn: 我们有过欢笑，但我不欣赏... 好吧，也许是时候我们...

segments.en: Baby, I love you so much.
You do?
I love you.
And I think you're awesome.
Oh, I love you too.
Come on, put the gun down.
Oh, baby.
I'm so sorry.
All right, well, Marco, you mentioned this word pet names.
segments.cn: 好吧，马尔科，你提到了这个词宠物名字。

segments.en: And what exactly is that?
All right, so pet names aren't names for your dogs or your cats, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，宠物名字不是给你的狗或猫的名字，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
They are those sweet names that you would call your boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 它们是你会称呼你的男朋友或女朋友的甜蜜名字。

segments.en: Okay, so like baby.
Okay, in our dialogue, we heard baby, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，在我们的对话中，我们听到了宝贝，对吧？

segments.en: So we're not talking about a little... A little child.
segments.cn: 所以我们不是在谈论一个小... 一个小孩。

segments.en: A little child, no.
This is usually how you would call maybe your girlfriend or boyfriend, baby.
segments.cn: 这通常是你会称呼你的女朋友或男朋友的方式，宝贝。

segments.en: Or honey.
Honey, right?
Hey honey, or honey, I'm home, right?
segments.cn: 嘿亲爱的，或者亲爱的，我回来了，对吧？

segments.en: But we also have other ones like sweetheart.
segments.cn: 但我们还有其他的，比如甜心。

segments.en: Or darling.
Or what about sweetie?
Or cutie.
Cutie, oh.
So some of these phrases can be a little bit like cheesy.
segments.cn: 所以这些短语有些可能有点肉麻。

segments.en: Maybe like... Yeah, a little too sweet.
segments.cn: 也许有点... 是的，有点太甜了。

segments.en: Too much.
Smookums.
Snookums.
Snookums.
Like snookums.
Okay.
Or honey bunny.
Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah.
We also have sweetie pie.
Yep.
Yeah.
Some of them will make some up, right?
segments.cn: 有些人会自己编造，对吧？

segments.en: Maybe they'll call their boyfriend poo bear.
segments.cn: 也许他们会叫他们的男朋友熊熊。

segments.en: Oh, yeah.
Right?
Like Winnie the Pooh, poo bear.
I heard dumpling is a common one.
segments.cn: 我听说饺子是一个常见的名字。

segments.en: Also, you can make up your own phrase.
segments.cn: 另外，你可以自己编造短语。

segments.en: You can make up your own pet names, right?
segments.cn: 你可以自己编造宠物名字，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, so I want to hear from our listeners.
segments.cn: 是的，所以我想听听我们的听众。

segments.en: Are there any common pet names in your language?
segments.cn: 你们的语言中有没有常见的宠物名字？

segments.en: I know that in Spanish, we sometimes call the... We can sometimes call our girlfriend gorda, which actually means fat.
segments.cn: 我知道在西班牙语中，我们有时会称我们的女朋友为gorda，这实际上是胖的意思。

segments.en: But it's not in a bad way.
Really?
It's a sweet way of calling your girlfriend.
segments.cn: 这是称呼你女朋友的一种甜蜜方式。

segments.en: And I know in French, you can say ma puce, which basically means my flea.
segments.cn: 我知道在法语中，你可以说ma puce，这基本上是我的跳蚤。

segments.en: Yeah, so some of them, if you translate, you wouldn't really use in English.
segments.cn: 是的，所以有些如果你翻译过来，你在英语中并不会真的使用。

segments.en: But let us know.
Translate from your language or other ones that you've heard maybe in movies or talk shows.
segments.cn: 从你的语言或你在电影或脱口秀中听到的其他名字翻译过来。

segments.en: And come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
Yep.
Leave your questions there, as well as your pet names.
segments.cn: 在那里留下你的问题，以及你的宠物名字。

segments.en: And Marco and I are always happy to see you there.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我总是很高兴看到你们。

segments.en: Okay, until next time.
Goodbye.
